rComments: Lectures are super boring but very easy content. The TAs in the class were brutal and rude if you didn't do exactly what they wanted. If you asked her questions outside of class, her email responses were often very rude. Weekly group and individual assignments with a final portfolio at the end. No exams which was nice but the class wasn't fun

Literally the worst prof I have ever had. You have weekly group projects with unclear instructions and when you fail to complete them to her standards, she belittles you and threatens to mark you as absent (3 absences and you fail the class). The class was a waste of time and money. This class caused more stress than it should have. 0 stars.

All I see is "easy A," and to be honest with you, this really should be the case; however, she is not a fair grader whatsoever and has no problems making students feel stupid. Your mark is based on 5 homework assignments, and then the other 50% is based on a portfolio (which the instructions are not clear on... surprise!). Avoid taking this class.

Course is boring, easy A+, prof does a good job. Day 1 she made it clear this is a course IN FRENCH not ABOUT FRENCH. Don't know why people are complaining about not being taught any grammar. Lots of work but EASY work for uni, most aren't even for marks. Read the instructions, listen, don't wait till last minute and maybe you won't struggle.

Prof is straight-forward, speaks clearly. Modules are SUPER organized, consistent structure. Due weekly: Answer a Q on Brightspace + a group assignment. That's it... They're to prove u were "present" in class, not for marks. 5 devoirs, each 10%. Again, straight-forward. Portfolio worth 50%. 2 days during reading week  easy. Basically Ontario FSF4U

There was no need for me to stress this much over a french class... brightspace page had over 280 tabs & unorganized. Really overwhelming. Mandatory discussion questions each class & group assignments each week & individual assignments on top of the weighted "devoirs" and the portfolio worth my whole grade that wasn't even clearly explained...

Not a great teacher gets annoyed at submitted work wrongly when my group didn't know it was grouped because she never told us it was grouped Has a type of personality to tell you without saying it that you're not smart with a skof at that Ignores our request for help I'm paying for this type of attitude 100% would not recommend waste of time?money

Prof. Knoerr wasn't too bad, but the course I took was useless. Everything was based on basic study strategies or discredited "learning styles" theories. We were graded on 5 assignments (worth 50%) and 1 final portfolio (50%). She gave fair marks on the assignments, but make sure you show up to the lectures that explain them to take THOROUGH notes.

Helene is a very nice prof. I took this class as an elective and it was definitely a bird course. The course was made up of many little projects and a 50% final project. She provided a sample of every project. I did not feel as if I needed to attend classes, but the French classes require attendance (although she did not often check).

Although she never marks attendance she explains exactly what she wants in her "devoirs". She is very specific, but once you understand her style should be an easy A. She is super passionate about this class and you could learn a few things to benefit you. It would be boring if not in the year though.

Great prof!! The first couple of assignments may seem unnecessary but at the end of the course, you can really see you're an improvement. Easy to get an A if you put in a bit of effort. No exams or midterms. 5 assignments and a 50% assignment.

Attendance isn't taken, however if you don't show up, you won't know what to include in your portfolio (large project due at the end of semester). Her classes are useless and boring but it is the easiest A ever. Do it for a grade booster, but not if you want to learn something.

This class is a great mark booster! Classes are not mandatory but I recommend going to understand the weekly assignments that are super easy. -50% of marks  assignments - 50%  take-home project that you work on all semester

Like some other reviews say, this class is a massive waste of time besides being an easy A. You won't really learn a lot and won't really develop your French a lot in this class. I don't understand why it's mandatory for FLS programs.

This class isn't worth taking if you want to learn something or value your time. It's an easy GPA booster but not much else. I was hoping this class would improve my French but in reality, your skills in French aren't evaluated at all, she arbitrarily grades you on how effective a learner she thinks you are.
Loved this class! 50% of the grade is 5 short assignments spread through the year, the other 50% is a final project which replaces the exam. Very easy to get 100% on the final project.

The prof is good; gives clear instructions, awesome feedback, & a fair workload. However if you would like to take the most pointless class ever, pick FLS2500. Sadly it is mandatory for FLS minors (and I think majors as well) & I honestly cannot comprehend why. The content is useless & boring and the prof drags on a class that couldve been short.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: She's very inconsistent in her grading. I would do weekly journal entries in a similar way each time and always got a different grade. The material covered in class was often for a different lesson in the content course so I would be unprepared for what was happening in my Political Science class but prepared for the lesson for the next week.

Definitely not the most approachable and her feedback is not always helpful. The material we did in this supporting course was not relevant to the other course and was essentially a waste of time, although it was an easy A.

She is not the most approachable person. You had to do 7 devoirs(easy A's) just know that she is very picky. Go to class or don't - but she explains exactly what she wants in the devoirs in class. No final exam or midterms. Instead, there is a portfolio that is worth 100% of your mark that includes everything you've done over the semester (easy A)

She is very passionate about her teaching. This class can be very boring if you do not try to take something from it. Best approach is to stay positive and put in the effort. With effort it is an easy A.

Took this as a class to help with POL 1501, however I got a lower mark in her class than in political science. Gives awful feedback, will tell you that your grammar is awful without specifying what mistakes you made. Very inconsistent with her expectations. Easy workload, but the same kind of useless french course I took in high school.

Several assignments, which means lots of room to succeed and get high markss! Knoerr is helpful and smart, gives great constructive feedback and cares about student success. I wish I had her for the actual content class (POL 1501) that's how clear, straightforward, and knowledgeable she was. The midterm is easy and there are 2 take-home exams.

Hélène is a passionate teacher that was very excited to debut a new FLS course this year. The course is very easy, and based on autonomous learning. Basically, the effort you put in is what you get from it. The content is quite uninteresting, but even if you put in minimal effort you should get an A.

For a nearly new class on learning how to learn French, she was an amazing prof! The class was super useful and straightforward, and it's easy to get A's on all the assignments if you put in the effort and follow her instructions. Everything counted towards the portfolio at the end of the semester, and she was specific with what should be used.

She is pretty rude, her exams are really hard and questions are always vague and hard to answer. Very low tolerance for imperfect french. The course itself was not helpful at all, and I actually did worse in this course than the accompanying course. Would not take again

Great prof and super friendly. Everything is accessible on blackboard. Homework is assigned every week, but it's fairly simple. Reminds me of my high school French class, pretty easy going. Just complete all your work and you'll get an easy A.

Although there was an assignment every week, they were quite simple and if you put in some effort it was easy to get 100% on all of them. Exams were very simple and outlined in a detailed manner the class before. Final Assignment of making a portfolio was graded easily if you put in the effort. Loved the Class.
WASNT THE GREATEST. RUDE, DOESNT CARE, AND LOSES YOUR WORK

after reading good ratings, i took the class. This teacher did not seem like she wanted to help the students. She  yelled at this girl in class when she (respectfully) asked her a question. the exams are too specific and are all trick questions. She snaps at students all the time. Phonology is super fun but please AVOID this teacher. learn from me!

She is kind, a good teacher and very helpful if you ask for it. The class was kind of pointless and you don't learn much but she does help you out a lot with your corresponding subject course and really does most of the work for you. Lots of little online assignments but it's all very simple. Felt like a high school class but not in a bad way!
Knows what shes talking about and lectures are enjoyable and flow nicely. You have to put in an effort to understand but if you keep up the class is no problem.

HORRIBLE! I am a straight A student so listen to me, unless this class is mandatory, drop it. She is an awful teacher, her examples are terrible, she goes way to fast, and she doesn't teach well (she never starts from the foundations, she just jumps right into it like you are her, and know the topic like the back of your hand). Horrible.
She's a very nice woman but I found her assignments incredibly confusing.  If you show her your work early she will give you lots of good feedback on it

She's a nice lady, and a decent professor. I will admit to her not being too clear on her expectations for the following course. However, she makes up for this by being VERY clear on what to expect come exam time. She's a pretty easy marker and is understanding and definitely likes to be more personal with her students. An all around good prof

She changes her mind constantly about what she wants you to do for next class, so it's impossible to get things done ahead of time because you'll just end up doing twice the work. She's not very clear about what she expects for any assignments, but the exams for this class are always pretty easy. No studying required!

I was in her FLS 3581, accompanying language course for intro to politics. She is never clear about what she wants to collect and she never tells you why you got something wrong on a fiche de lecture or quiz de verification de lectures. Also you can never ask questions because 99% of the time she has already moved on before you can raise ur hand.

Very clear, lots of examples. No textbooks, all powerpoint and pdf texts that you CAN print out if you want. She is a very serious prof, so if you are committed she won't have a problem helping you. We're halfway in and things are going great.
no examples, talkes to fast, killers exams...details are important!

She knows her stuff...which sometimes isn't all that good. She sometimes forgets that we don't really know it. She is very nice and there when you need her. She is not always clear during class, push for examples because she won't give any. A LOT OF PRINTING!

Gives a lot of links to practice at home. Is willing to help students if they ask, and reviews the material at the beginning of every class. Great prof to have for phonetics, she obviously knows her stuff and tries to convey the material as smoothly as possible. NOTE: tests are hard if you dont do the required assignments. Otherwise, they are ok.

gives links to websites to practice. useful IF you use them! the TPs are a joke, so make sure to have a buddy sign you in so you can do better things! a lot of notes to print out. last test was a KILLER! work/study with friends whenever possible! overall: fair prof, talks way too fast sometimes!

She gives you a list of sites to practice phonetics at home...isn't that what we're suppost to during the DGD? The DGD is a joke, we did nothing useful. The class itself is pretty easy, but the prof gets you in the end with the hardest test alive. Yuck!
shes nice all year and then gives you a D with no warning. not cool.
very clear, you know where she's going with the topic. her easy test aren't so easy but she is helpful and seems as if she wants you to do good! i'd recommend her!
